title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: The expected behavior is that when changing the data source, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page.
3. Change the data source.

Actual result:
There is no listing of children nodes when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.

Close the data set editor and reopen it.
